info.title: Responsibility Management Teams
info.description: This service allows you to create team details like header, owner, member, member function, attributes, and hierarchy of parent and child teams. You can perform read, update, and delete operations on team details. You can also perform other operations like prepone team header start date and unassign team owner and team member function. The service returns an appropriate success or error response while performing these operations.

x-sap-shortText: Create, read, update, and delete team details in Responsibility Management using this synchronous inbound service

get.summary: Reads the member function details of a team.
get.description: Reads the team member function details using team member ID, team member type, team global ID, and team function.

parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.description: Creates the team member function using team member ID, team member function effective date, and more.

get.summary: Reads the header details of a team.
get.description: Reads the team header details using global team ID, team effective date, team name, team owner ID, team status, or team type.

parameters.name: $filter

post.summary: Creates header details of a team.
post.description: Creates team header along with team attribute, team member, team member function, and team owner using global team ID, team effective date, team name, team owner ID, team owner type, team owner effective date, and team type.

parameters.name: RespyMgmtGlobalTeamID
parameters.description: RespyMgmtGlobalTeamID

parameters.name: RespyMgmtTeamEffectiveDate
parameters.description: RespyMgmtTeamEffectiveDate

patch.summary: Updates header details of a team.
patch.description: Updates a team header using global team ID and team effective date. You can update team name, team description, and team status using this operation.

delete.summary: Deletes header details of a team.
delete.description: Deletes a team header using global team ID and team effective date.

post.summary: Deletes the team member and member function of a team.

parameters.description:
RespyMgmtGlobalTeamID  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: RespyMgmtTeamMemberID

parameters.name: RespyMgmtTeamMbrEffectiveDate
parameters.description:
RespyMgmtTeamMbrEffectiveDate  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes and prefixed with `datetime`, e.g. `datetime'2017-12-31T00:00'`)

parameters.name: RespyMgmtTeamMemberType
parameters.description:
RespyMgmtTeamMemberType  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

post.summary: Deletes all entries of a specified owner to the given team.
post.description: Deletes all entries of a specified team owner using global team ID, team owner ID, and team owner type. It also makes sure the team does not end up without any team owner at any point in time.

(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=152).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

multipart/mixed;boundary=request-separat.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET TeamMemberFunctionSet HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

multipart/mixed.example:
--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--
